Commenting on the situation in Cambodia, Zhou Enlai told David Bruce, the head of the U.S. liaison office in Beijing, on May 18, 1973, that "the only way to find a solution was for the parties concerned to implement fully all the subsidiary clauses of Article 20" ofthe Paris Peace Agreement, which required the withdrawal of all foreign troops from Cambodia (and Laos).
